    subroutine sort(arr) integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
        integer :: i, j, temp
        do i=1, size(arr)
            do j=i+1, size(arr)
                if (arr(i) > arr(j)) then
                    temp = arr(i)
                    arr(i) = arr(j)
                    arr(j) = temp

program main
    implicit none

    integer :: n, i, c, bills, len_s, pos
    integer, allocatable :: list(:)
    integer, allocatable :: digits(:)
    character(len=20) :: s
    character(len=1) :: c_char

    ! First part: read n and list, compute c
    read*, n

    read*, list
    call sort(list) c = 1 do i = 1, n
        if (list(i) >= c) then
            c = c + 1
        end if

    len_s = len_trim(s)

    do i = 0, len_s - 1

        c_char = s(pos:pos)
        digits(i) = ichar(c_char) - ichar('0')

    bills = 0 do i = 0, len_s

            digits(i) = 0

        ! Process current digit

            bills = bills + 5

            end if
        else
            bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))
            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
        end if

contains

    ! Bubble sort subroutine
    subroutine sort(arr)
        integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
        integer :: i, j, temp
        do i = 1, size(arr)
            do j = i + 1, size(arr) if (arr(i) > arr(j)) then
                    temp = arr(i)
                    arr(i) = arr(j)
                    arr(j) = temp
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end subroutine sort

end program main

program main
    implicit none

    integer :: n, i, c, bills, len_s, pos
    integer, allocatable :: list(:)
    integer, allocatable :: digits(:)
    character(len=20) :: s
    character(len=1) :: c_char

    ! First part: read n and list, compute c
    read*, n
    allocate(list(n))
    read*, list
    call sort(list)

    c = 1
    do i = 1, n
        if (list(i) >= c) then
            c = c + 1
        end if
    end do

    ! Second part: process c as the input number
    write(s, '(i0)') c
    s = adjustl(s)
    len_s = len_trim(s)

    allocate(digits(0:len_s))
    digits = 0

    ! Fill the digits array with reversed digits of s
    do i = 0, len_s - 1
        pos = len_s - i
        c_char = s(pos:pos)
        digits(i) = ichar(c_char) - ichar('0')
    end do

    ! Process the digits array
    bills = 0
    do i = 0, len_s
        ! Handle digits(i) == 10
        if (digits(i) == 10) then
            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
            digits(i) = 0
        end if

        ! Process current digit
        if (digits(i) < 5) then
            bills = bills + digits(i)
        else if (digits(i) == 5) then
            bills = bills + 5
            if (digits(i+1) >= 5) then
                digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
            end if
        else
            bills = bills + (10 - digits(i))
            digits(i+1) = digits(i+1) + 1
        end if
    end do

    print*, bills

    deallocate(list, digits)

contains

    ! Bubble sort subroutine
    subroutine sort(arr)
        integer, intent(inout) :: arr(:)
        integer :: i, j, temp
        do i = 1, size(arr)
            do j = i + 1, size(arr)
                if (arr(i) > arr(j)) then
                    temp = arr(i)
                    arr(i) = arr(j)
                    arr(j) = temp
                end if
            end do
        end do
    end subroutine sort

end program main

This should handle all the steps correctly. The bubble sort is used for the first part's list sorting. The second part processes the digits as per the Java code's logic. The variables are properly declared, and the indices are handled correctly.
